Posts.Content: I am in the process of researching doctors in Illinois to perform my surgery. Unfortunately we switched Insurance plans this year and it has limited my options. I am looking to see if anyone has had their surgery done through any of the Advocate Hospitals or Loyola University and have a doctor they trust. I hear great things about Loyola University Medical Center and hoping there is a highly rated Urologist there that I can trust to perform the surgery, but also exploring all the options in the Advocate Network of Hospitals.

Posts.Content: Update: PSA 8.6 Dec 2015 Biopsy Feb 2016 12 biopsies taken 4 of 6 biopsies G 3+4 (Right Side) Now needing to decide between surgery and radiation. Any advice you can provide would be great. At this point just trying to gather as much information as I can and then use all that information to make a decision.
Posts.Title: What to do if PSA Level is High

Posts.Content: I went to the Dr. to discuss issues with urination (slow stream, finish then start up again...things haven't been right for about a year). I am a 48 year old male. Dr. suggested testing my PSA Level in my blood. Results came back PSA Level: 8.6. He then suggested an ultrasound and a referral to a Urologist. Ultrasound came back that the Prostate was not enlarged and organs looked OK (Does this rule out BPH?). Appointment with Urologist is scheduled for 1/21. What are my next steps? What should I be worried about?
Posts.Title: What to do if PSA Level is High

Posts.Content: Thanks for the valuable information. I will keep you updated with the results.
